website_summaries.verdict: The Motorola Moto G7 Power offers excellent performance, two-day battery life, and an attractive design for a budget-friendly price.

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife, bought when released - preordered. Arrived on time, impressive design, my wife is legacy user had moto g2 and g4 before - is well impressed with the new phone. Please note arrived with silicone phone cover :)
customer_reviews.author: Sirsnal

customer_reviews.title: Great quality/price
customer_reviews.text: Moving over from the Moto Z... This is a little less powerful on paper but I prefer this by far.. Battery lasts me the full day which is awesome! Screen is beautiful, nice colours, nice size. Fingerprint and face recognition are both fast.. It has a 3.5mm jack! I don't get why so many phones lack this these days! Never again will I get a jackless phone! Recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Adam Young

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This should settle the debate regarding g7 having NFC or not for once and all.
customer_reviews.author: nikhil

customer_reviews.title: Compact phone with Android 9
customer_reviews.text: Primarily bought this as I needed a new phone and wanted a compact one with Android 9. In use it feels snappy with no slow downs. The screen is clear, bright and it's easy to use with one hand. The camera performance was better than expected with good colour on the outdoor shots and the indoor shots taken with good light were also good. Shots in low light were better than expected but not as good as more expensive phones with some visible grain. Both photos were taken indoors one in day light and the other in artificial light with HDR on. As for the battery I've been getting an average 2 days from a single charge with average use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Appalling Amazon Customer Service, faulty screen impossible to read screen content.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor screen quality, constantly flickered- less than a month in use. Took 95 min call to get a replacement agreed. I then had to chase this up week later. I returned the faulty product (signed receipt by Amazon). Amazon charged me £184.44 for the 'non-return'! Spent an 90 min trying to get my money back. Two weeks later still waiting for refund! Shockingly poor service.
customer_reviews.author: c huntbach

customer_reviews.title: Good value and very smart phone
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a Motorola and loves it. My other phone was finally dead after 4 drops and I got this from one in a hurry. Cannot fault it. It has some great logic to it, making suggestions on occasion as to how I can improve things, eh face recognition and finger print reader. It's all fabulous! Great batter life, camera, fast, lots of memory. I take many photos of wildlife, my boy, plants, etc. It's a very good camera. I use it for both work and home and so far I have no complaints. Mine came with NFC on it, so no issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Give with the left take with the right
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from a g6 play, many things are an improvement, it's faster, screen is better, new type c cable, battery life is still excellent. But UK version no longer has NFC UK version despite press releases etc still does not have a compass so a number of useful compass apps will not works. So they give a little with faster processor but took away NFC so no touch pay in shops and still no compass Is it a good phone hell yes still best on the market at this price but if you need those 2 things not the phone for you
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mark Mason

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Value Android Phone
customer_reviews.text: The plus points for me are:- 1. Fast charging coupled with very good battery life 2. A lightweight and good sized phone which easily fits into a pocket 3. Ability to change the text size to something larger than default 4, May not be the fastest processor but good enough for me - no issues I have not used the finger print recognition so I cannot rate it or comment I have not tried the face recognition option so cannot rate it or comment No downsides for me as a user
customer_reviews.author: Keep Calm

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, no need to buy a case!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Motorola phones and this one certainly does not disappoint. FYI, do not buy a case for it as it comes with one! (I figured out this the hard way after buying a case online at the same time when I bought the phone!) Loving the big screen and portrait mode on the. Facial recognition and fingerprint recognition is also pretty good (although not 100%, but what phone will be?!)
customer_reviews.author: MISS RL HILL

customer_reviews.title: The BEST PHONE ever! - Great Battery life, Great software stability
customer_reviews.text: purchased this to replace my blackberry (love blackberry phones) , hands down, one of the BEST phones I have ever used, absolutely FANTASTIC, Motorola have gained a customer for life. Battery life is GREAT! I charge it every 1.5- 2 days ( phone is used alot - whatsapp, messages, calls,browsing). The phone software very stable, very quick phone, great layout, isnt too big to hold, and does not weigh you down when in pocket. Honestly, this is a great phone, at double the price I would have considered this a bargain. WELL DONE MOTOROLA!
customer_reviews.author: The Internet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Mid-Range Downgrade
customer_reviews.text: Came from a Nokia 7 plus mid range phone which is a similar price point. Nokia had a fatal flaw with a loose power jack and poor support for that known problem which made me change vendor. Main selling points for the Moto was near stock Android and dual SIM. The reviews were also very good. I wasnt expecting a massive gain in specification from the Nokia, more a gentle evolution but versus the 7 plus, this is a regression of build exterior build quality, processor performance, battery life and terrible camera quality. There is nothing worse than buying new tech and going backwards. Had this for just over a month and now considering a trade in.
customer_reviews.author: S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an ageing Samsung S5. It was a Really easy transfer over my apps automatically. I am impressed with the battery life, the fast charger supplied works well. It was nice to receive a free case as standard. The camera is impressive, and the screen is really vibrant. Speaker volume is still too loud in quietest setting. Overall I am glad I didn't spend twice as much in a flagship phone, as this does all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It For The £
customer_reviews.text: Up graded from a Moto G4 Play Love it it face book etc was becoming unusable on my old phone kept stalling on loading vids etc, this is sooooo much quicker, battery life is great and vid quality more than adequate
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Why buy any other phone?
customer_reviews.text: For everyone spending money on 24 month contracts, just work out how much money you're spending, then take a look at this... This phone is sleek, stylish, fast and responsive. It comes with more memory that I'll every use, an amazing screen and great camera. I've use a few phones down the years and this not only surprises me with the price, but with entire quality of the phone. I will always buy Motorola in the future.
customer_reviews.author: BiffaTheKnight

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic budget future proof phone but not as hardy as it's predecessors.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these phones. All Motorola's I've ever owned have lasted the test of time. My phones get some serious abuse and my last phone, the Motorola g5 I didn't even buy a case for and it's been sailing, hiking, cycling and all sorts and it just would not die. This phone is sadly less sturdy. Already dropped and cracked the corner of the screen which I'm disappointed about but otherwise, if it's like my other Motos, I hope to have this for many years more! Don't know why they put the finger print reader on the back this time, however. Worst place for it when it's in a holder or case.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Thom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: Used to own original Moto g which was a great phone,all reviews seem to say how good the g7 is,I've owned a lot of phones and was very disappointed with this. Screen not the best, it's slow and battery life is very poor,which was the deal breaker,sent back after 2 weeks,shame was expecting much better
customer_reviews.author: michael f ball

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my wife, she loved it. Needed a phone quickly myself (my LG g3 suddenly went a bit crazy after nearly 4 years of use) so simply bought another one for myself. Long battery life, fast, great camera. If you are after a cost-effective phone that will suit most people with normal smartphone usage then you will struggle to beat this for value.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: First Moto Phone that has caused this reaction - very, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Only 2.4GHz Wifi - No connection to 5Ghz Wifi. Cannot understand the thinking behind this as this is a basic level of service that you would expect in any phone. I set it up, then restored to Factory defaults and tried again. Never thought that reason I could not locate my home WiFi is that the handset could not see it. REALLY DISAPPOINTING. Handset going back
customer_reviews.author: Philemyy

customer_reviews.title: Bit disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: I love Motorola phones but am a little disappointed with this model. The first half of the battery charge seems to go down quite quickly, though the second half lasts a lot longer. The camera isn't as good as the previous model which is disappointing. But the fingerprint reader is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Green

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE
customer_reviews.text: THIS PHONE HAS A KNOWN ISSUE. LENOVO HAVE BEEN AWARE FOR 18+ MONTHS BUT HAVE DONE NOTHING. THE ISSUE IS THE PHONE CONSTANTLY AND WITHOUT WARNING LOSES WIFI CONNECTION, NO, IT IS NOT DUE TO DISTANCE, IT IS JUST USELESS. JUST GOOGLE " MOTO G7 LOSING WIFI" AND YOU WILL SEE PAGES OF COMPLAINTS..... WITHOUT ANY RESPONSE FROM LENOVO, MY PHONE HAS BEEN WITH THEM FOR OVER A MONTH THIS YEAR, IT CAME BACK WITH THE SAME FAULT, WITH THE MESSAGE " WE CANNOT FIX THE FAULT SO WE HAVE REPLACED THE INTERNALS".... SO REPLACED TRASH WITH TRASH... WELL DONE.. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone on the recommendation of my daughters and have not regretted the purchase. I found the phone easy to set up and use with my existing sim card. I decided against the use of the fingerprint reader or face recognition. I prefer to use a pin. There are one or two function I am not sure how to use but a visit to my daughter or to my young grandson should sort me out.
customer_reviews.author: Kafi York

customer_reviews.title: Monster Battery
customer_reviews.text: This phone is perfect for me, I hate having to charge away from home and the battery is a monster, 3 days without need for charge with modest use....Twitter, internet, WhatsApp, basic games, maps etc....I can completely rely on it. Even a more aggressive user will find it will only need a charge once a day at most. Even then it has ‘turbo charge’ so will be ready again in an hour or so. I have switched from Samsung Galaxy and glad I did. Cons are that the camera is pretty average and the WiFi only seems to connect to 2g network at home ( it’s fine in public WiFi), however I dont notice a slowdown in performance.
customer_reviews.author: Md

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Well I got my partner the G7 and ordered P20 LITE for myself because it was on offer. Regrets? Well hell yes. I just cant fault the G7 in any way at this price totally recommend it. Don't make the same mistake I did. If your budget is £200-£300 then get this phone..my p20 is good, just not quite as good with some niggling flaws such as unreliable Bluetooth which surprised me!
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my much loved Moto G. I'm impressed by the battery life, which regularly stretches to two full days, and the speed of recharging. Internal storage capacity is great, with the added benefit of an SD card slot, which I use for storing music and photos, allowing maximum internal storage space for apps. On the subject of photos, the camera is decent. The auto settings are usually spot on, but if you enjoy the technicalities of photography, the manual settings allow for greater control over the image.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only had it a few days. Looks nice but I like to have a case with card holders anyway. Choose this as good reviews and price. I use the finger print as they say the face recognition isn’t as secure. Motorola has good tips to help you use it to its fullest. The back does get a lot of fingerprints but easy to wipe . I’m a safety freak I will be getting a glass tempered protector for the screen . It does come with a clear case, free, so if you want it’s good to go straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Moto G7 (not power, play or plus)  Has NFC,dual SIM, multiple user
customer_reviews.text: This is for the Moto G7 (not power, play or plus) I really like the G7 range but was looking for a phone with NFC. Moto G7 does have NFC. It has dual SIM which is useful so I can use the phone for work and personal. You can set up users so I can log out of my work screen and open my personal sceen just like having two separate phones. Downloaded compass and it works well and so does sky map. The camera seem okay for what I've used so far. This is a really good phone for the money. Oh I forgot, it has WiFi calling if your carrier supports it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon exclusive dual SIM UK model has NFC, VoLTE and WiFi calling
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Amazon exclusive Moto g7, dual Sim, UK model. I can confirm it has : - NFC - WiFi calling (works on EE mobile network) - VoLTE Please note whilst you can activate WiFi calling on the phone, your mobile network must allow WiFi calling for WiFi calling to work. Early days, but so far so good. Haven't turned on face recognition hence the low score.
customer_reviews.author: mati

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, glitchy software
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic phone and hardware, software needs improving. A month in and my only gripe is the glitchy UI/ OS/ App launcher. Every now and again an app freezes or the touch screen stops working for 30 secs then message to restart/wait! I still haven't figured out the facial recognition either yet but have a feeling it might not work. Otherwise great value for money 3rd month in now, the phone now freezes then restarts randomly but regularly. Only way to solve is to get and keep running task killer regularly. It can't handle multiple apps. Why put all this memory on it then? The UI needs upgrade, or don't get a load of apps on it!
customer_reviews.author: V. Masuku

customer_reviews.title: Good value phone but slows with age and stops recognising SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Third MotoG phone I've had and the third one that, at some point, just stops recognising the micro SD card, resulting in you losing all data, images and whatever else on the phone. Fingerprint reader is patchy, often does not work. The functioning of the phone slows down noticeably with time. Honestly, used to love this phone for the comparative power and value but will now never buy Motorola again.
customer_reviews.author: MaxEv

customer_reviews.title: Quality phone for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe you get this many features on a phone for the price. Bought it for my wife who's not really into technology, but does use quite a number of different apps. It runs them all really quickly and smoothly. Easy to use layout. Not sure why other phone makers mess with the stock Android operating system when it's this good. Means the phone doesn't come with apps you never use or want and can't them off your phone, so it saves memory and works faster!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Bought mainly to use when on holiday for using as a satnav, street maps, local facilities, getting weather forecast, etc. I also use it to check emails, local news, etc. Much quicker than logging onto my computer each time. I'm not interested in downloading films or on-line games, so for me this is an ideal phone. Excellent build quality and a bright screen, so for me great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Bevis

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish aftercare, but exceptional phone.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this phone with her birthday money in July 2019. She loves it, nothing negative at all from her. However, although it's been in the protective case which was provided, the power button has fallen out. Unable to find any way to either get a replacement (as it's faulty) or even just a replacement button! Even checked eBay. Extremely disappointed in the after care provided when purchasing this phone, but the phone itself (other than the button issue) is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for the  Moto G6
customer_reviews.text: Got the G7 to replace my Moto G6 which had a security issue (as a result of a security update) after about a year of faultless use. The G7 is a fantastic replacement in terms of spec, reliability and price (essentially the same price as the G6). As with the G6 I can find no fault with the G7, everything works well, better than might be reasonably expected in this price range and I would highly recommend it for those who want to avoid paying more than they need to for an entry level smartphone that is definitely more than the some of its parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone let down by bad Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Good phone with very good battery life but let down by bad Bluetooth. If it wasn't for the fact that it's impossible to get it to connect with my EarFun UBOOM (ever other phone in the house can) I would have given this 5 stars. I can connect alright to other Bluetooth devices but it would appear that this phone is not compatible with all Bluetooth devices, which is strange because I thought that was the whole point of Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Foscolo

customer_reviews.title: Motorola G7 Power (Impressive)
customer_reviews.text: This 6.2 inch mobile phone has exceeded my expectations of a mobile of any kind. I had a Huawei which suddenly died on me. Bought this and my god how powerful and user friendly this G7 is. Quick, solidly built and super easy to transfer data from old to new phone. Battery life is unbelieveable. The Moto features are super useful and yet easy. A 5* phone. Thank you Motorola. Amazon delievered it within 4 days. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: a10nmw

customer_reviews.title: A lot of phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this phone for 6 months now and having previously had the G5plus can definitely say that this is a major upgrade. The battery life was a big concern at first but I realised that it just needed a few charging cycles before performance was as advertised. Great screen and sound performance. The design is nice and modern. In fact it often gets mistaken for an IPhone X which I guess is a complement considering it costs 10x less! All in all very happy and can see me having this easily for the next couple years.
customer_reviews.author: silentexpression

customer_reviews.title: OK, but I think mine must have been faulty
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking forward to getting this phone for a while, but not as good as the reviews I'd read. Battery drains before the end of the day. Used it for 3 days and the screen frequently froze. I found it very heavy too, but that's personal preference. When it wasn't freezing, it was very quick and good camera and felt expensive . I think mine may have just been faulty. I've returned the item and will stick with my old Honour Lite 9.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Bargain phone, powerful enough for most tasks
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these for the nephews for Christmas(having used a G6 Play for quite a while myself) as they are at that age where they want their own gadgets and I have to say.....bang per buck its a lot of phone for the money! Big enough screen, plenty of storage and powerful enough to play the games they want to play - and being from Amazon you know if something goes wrong you have the UK guarantee available (but as these are quite sturdy phones it should be fine for quite some time!
customer_reviews.author: Mr P R W Davies

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this model. The sound quality is terrible and the WiFi is also really bad. I was getting about 1-3mb download speed regularly doing speed tests on a 250mb line. I tested other devices at the same time and they were fine so it was definitely an issue with the phone. I ended up returning the phone and getting a full refund. I paid a little more and bought the Moto One, which has been fantastic so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slick, lots of spec at an amazingly affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the original Moto g, g4 and been impressed, this phone was a no brainer for me. It offers slick operability and is living up to the other good reviews from tech reviewers and also other purchasers on here. This was my main reason for purchase as my older model was slowing up. It is outstanding value for money. The phone comes with a free clear case which is more than fit for purpose. Would recommend to others in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Shan26

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is so much cheaper than Apple, Samsung etc. and you don't really have to compromise on much at all. There's plenty of storage the camera is great and the phone generally performs very well. When it's this cheap you can afford to upgrade a little more regularly. It's no more than £7 per month over 3 years, or £10 per month over 2 years. Add a decent sim deal for another £10 a month and you get a good package for £20 a month. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but watch out using an SD card
customer_reviews.text: Really like this phone, great screen, fast and easy to use. Great value for money. I did have a problem though with using the micro SD card, I'm sure I inserted it into the caddy properly but it never registered and then it got stuck and I just can't get it out! Phone still works on both SIM cards but still a bit annoying. Not sure if its a common problem or I was just unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but missing some of the basics
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice looking phone and overall performance is ok. However, I have found two issues with basic features that beat the purpose of why I bought it. The battery life is quite poor, even being brand new it doesn't last a day so I don't know what it will be like after a year. The other main issue is that I believe the wifi module has a very short range as I used to be able to get good internet anywhere in my house with a cheap Samsung J5 and how I can only get good internet in the room with the router and the adjecent ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: I would rate this as 70% as good as my Pixel 2XL at only 25% of the price. Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is a speedy phone. Very light android skin, very close to my Pixel 2XL. Neat touches like peak notifications, waving your hand above the phone to wake it up. Seriously thinking of getting one of these instead of upgrading at the end of my contract. Sim only might be the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Guest

customer_reviews.title: NFC if you buy the UK model
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from this listing in the UK, this phone DOES have NFC. Also works with WiFi calling on Three.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Culver

customer_reviews.title: Best cost benefit
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great phone! Not only does it take less than 30min to fully recharge, but the battery lasts ages. It's light and has a luxury feel to it. The camera is alright, I like the portrait mode and it works well if you have good light. It has NFC (very handy) and the fingerprint reader works well. The software runs smoothly without any glitches so far (+1year of use). For the price I paid, this is a total bargain. I had 2 of the previous versions and I vouch for Motorola, their quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Weslei

customer_reviews.title: Love it, in a nutshell!!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love??? My phone isn't my life, but there's nothing negative I can say. Battery life is fantastic, does everything I want it to do: photos, videos, Netflix, YouTube, Spotify and all the other stuff I need it to do. I honestly have used this phone for everything I normally do and can't fault it. 3 days is not a cheeky proclaimation, on average I get just over 2 days, so if I didn't use it so much I'd probably get more. Photos are not too bad at all. Not immaculate, but definitely more than acceptable. Couldn't recommend this smartphone more.
customer_reviews.author: A. English

customer_reviews.title: Worst mobile ever
customer_reviews.text: Firstly let me say I have had several Moto phones over the years and have loved them all, so was expecting this one to be the same. How disappointed I was it is probably the worst mobile phone I've ever had,it works fine on 4 g but is awful on WiFi so slow and constantly dropping have since done some homework and found out this is a major problem with this model of phone
customer_reviews.author: bowler1

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Didn't use the fingerprint or face recognition wasn't recognised as a secure method battery life up to now is better than my Moto g4 couple of things we're a bit different but got used to them reasonable well for the price would definitely recommend slight niggle is that the charging cable wasn't very long
customer_reviews.author: Re Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Moto G7 is a whizz
customer_reviews.text: My wife is no longer able to use her phone and my Moto E3 was beginning to slow up considerably. I bought the G7 because it is a dual Sim phone so I can have both old phones rolled into one, and can use it as if it were two different phones when you make a call is askes which provider to use. I do not spend huge amounts of money on a phone and this one does all I require for an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Impressive underdog
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this phone,competes with the best for a fraction of the price, I've had it for a month now, it's fast, loads of on board space, great finger print reader, and above average screen quality. Only thing I think could be better is the quality of the speaker, it is a bit crackly when put on full blast, however I didn't buy it for the sound quality so I can live with that and the camera quality-not the best, but hey. Overall I'm impressed, might just get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Itu

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, please...
customer_reviews.text: Wrote a full review for this item. Disappeared for some IT reason. Don't waste your money. Get yourself a descent phone, not that piece of crap... Everything on it is pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon Arabov

customer_reviews.title: Problems after just a few months.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July but am now experiencing charging problems, i.e Turbo charge not working and ordinary charging only intermittently. Have tried a few things suggested by forums but no luck so far. Finger print reader not that accurate either but otherwise no problems. Update.. Now been repaired by Fonefix... Excellent service phone now perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Attrick

customer_reviews.title: Microphone not working after one month of use
customer_reviews.text: It appeared to work fine at the beginning and after one month the microphone does not work properly. No one can hear me when i make calls or someone calls me...constantly telling to speak louder. I am frustrated as the amazon said it's outside of the return window and will not refund the money.
customer_reviews.author: Fatime

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for a good price
customer_reviews.text: It was quite different from the samsung I have been used to but now I can say you get a lot on this phone and once you get used to it there is no problems, after using it for the short time I have had it there have been no problems and I must say battery seems to go on for ever, yes I am pleased with this phone
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great big let down
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed with this phone. I have previously owned a Moto G and G4, I'm not being an idiot expecting unrealistic things from a budget smart phone, I am fully aware of what I am buying when I choose to shun flagship models of the big brands. I was always impressed with this line of phones but this version freezes frequently and glitches all the time. Furthermore, I operate it in battery saver mode to ensure it makes it through a single day. There are good bits about the phone but it doesnt stand up (relatively) to previous iterations of this line of phones.
customer_reviews.author: mr sa kitching

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and there's a reason for it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an ageing S7. I had no great expectations that it was going to be a world beater, I expected the camera to be average (which it is), I didn't however expect the performance of the phone to be so patchy. Calls can often be muffled, bluetooth is unreliable and doesn't work when trying to make calls in the car. Web pages can be really slow to load.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Barber

customer_reviews.title: Does not support HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that this phone, despite have a type C USB port does not suport phone to TV connection using HDMI cable. It was the major reason why I bought the phone....
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Banda

customer_reviews.title: A great phone
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few Android phones, starting with an HTC Hero, through Nexus 4, Nexus 5g This is the best by far, everything works, it's super smoothe, and after a series of prompted updates it's running Android 10 It's light, quite compact for a 5.7" display, and smart looking What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: N. Henfrey

customer_reviews.title: Moto G7 (not power version) but Wrong Colour
customer_reviews.text: Ordered white and box said content white. When opened phone was black couldn't be bothered to return it! However very good phone for the money, good screen and sound. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It is very slow and, despite the fact I did not change network when I purchased this phone, the signal is worse. The battery does not last very long but, on the upside, it charges quickly. The charger also has a different size connector than most other non-Apple devices which I did not realise until after I had bought it. Overall I would rate this phone as disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Phone
customer_reviews.text: Best phone so far. Battery life finally what I need. I've loaded it with apps and it lasts way more than 24 hours even with a lot of browsing. No complaints at all. No point spending a fortune for features you won't even notice. This is a really good phone at a terrific price.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenhart

customer_reviews.title: Good price for nice range of features incl NFC
customer_reviews.text: Good price for nice range of features. Even has NFC. Straight forward installation, apart from SIM tray which is flimsy, fitting SIM and SD card was the hardest part of the installation.
customer_reviews.author: SHAR

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at launch and have been meaning to review as it's such a great phone for the price. I've previously paid more, but was pleasantly surprised how good this is as more budget priced phones are normally clunkier software wise. I did have some niggles at first, but a couple of updates from Motorola have sorted these out too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a technical whiz. I researched moderately priced phones with decent storage capacity and reasonable size screen without being too big and cumbersome. I decided on this and it is comparable to my daughter's new iPhone which she will pay for, for the next 2 years whereas this will be mine after 4 payments on a sim only contract. Feel quite smug!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a battery !
customer_reviews.text: The life of the battery after charging is as advertised. If you turn off the phone when not in use, e.g overnight, then it lasts even longer. There's no doubt it's a big phone, too big for a back pocket, really. I bought a case which allows it to be carried horizontally, attached to a belt through a clip or with belt loops. It means I can sit down without it digging into my thigh.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W

customer_reviews.title: moto g7 Power 6.2-Inch Android 9.0 Pie
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of superb battery ( two days without charging) and capabilities. Would like to eliminate the weird "Hello Moto" greeting every time it switches on but haven't found how yet. Superb photo cameras. Impressive phone for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Class leading midrange phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent upper midrange phone. Build quality, performance, screen, camera and battery life are all good considering its price point. Android operating system software is all present and correct with updates. I don't use the facial recognition function on this phone. Would buy again if required.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Coates

customer_reviews.title: Motorola gold ! cracking little phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little thing..I moved from a G4 to this g7 play and I'm very glad I did,I didn't want a large screened smart phone so I opted for this smaller one.. performance is very adequate for my purposes ..all in all a quality made budget smart phone ..Motorola is a great brand and il be definitely be buying another Moto in the future
customer_reviews.author: Mr..gjb

customer_reviews.title: 6 months in
customer_reviews.text: The good; it was fairly cheap and works ok as a phone. The bad. No NFC. Battery power greatly diminished after the first couple of months. Really Sluggish operating system, show to load and manage even simple apps. Poor camera quality front and back. Moto actions don't work, or work really badly. This was my 5th moto phone as I loved the series. I shan't be getting the next model.
customer_reviews.author: simevo

customer_reviews.title: Mistake
customer_reviews.text: I got this after I drowned my Honor 10. Thought I'd stay western bc of the Huawei kerfuffle. In comparison it's just an illuminated brick and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: davidhill

customer_reviews.title: A good phone with issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good phone. Fingerprint reader not totally reliable and had little/no joy with the face recognition. Screen quality is good as is the sound. Plenty of internal memory and the ability to add additional memory via a SD card is a bonus. The lack of NFC and single band WiFi is a shame. I had loads of problems with WiFi speeds. With Bluetooth switched off, WiFi download speeds were 50% faster - even Motorola couldn't resolve this! Finished up returning the phone and buying a G8 plus - NFC, dual band and download speeds not dramatically affected by Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Moto g7 used but in very good condition very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic phone easy to use . The condition said used the condition of the phone is immaculate up and running with in an hr after new updates and but all items on from the cloud arived within 2 days of order very nice price to pay very happy with order .
customer_reviews.author: c and b with kitty cat's

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant phone.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this G7 to replace an old Samsung J3 - very impressed - great speed, battery life and fast charging with the turbo charger supplied. Very easy to set up everything moved over from my old phone without any problems - even the wifi codes that I use away from home. Like Google Lens - this has really surprised me and has recognised locations plants and butterflies. The gps signal is acquired very fast. Not used the camera a lot yet but it shows promise. Must have 90% of the features of a top of the range Apple or Samsung phone for 20% of the cost. Thanks Moto a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Webbo

customer_reviews.title: Cannot comment as returned
customer_reviews.text: Purchased but returned as I wanted the plus. Cannot comment
customer_reviews.author: Mr C E F Moulinie

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved the Motos and this one is no exception. The phone itself is really slick and well designed. The screen resolution is fantastic. Camera works really well in well-lit conditions. Battery life is unquestionably good. Really love this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Brett J Devey

customer_reviews.title: Budget mobile that's better than it's expensive competitors
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my old Moto 4g, this mobile is great, camera much better than my old 4g, battery life and quick charging also excellent, as is the screen, much bigger memory and for the price of a tadge under £200, l couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Harry B

customer_reviews.title: Top android phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone no problems with it fast and slick good photos calls are nice and clear WiFi works well no dropouts and good signal connects to my car Bluetooth straight away can't recommend it enough
customer_reviews.author: redrizla

customer_reviews.title: Why buy any other
customer_reviews.text: Daughter very happy with this phone. Functions far ahead of competition in similar price bracket
customer_reviews.author: iwrightson

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Motorola, but this moto G7 was a giant leap forward from my old one, it seems to do everything that my wife's iPhone does but at a fraction of the cost, battery life is absolutely terrific, I love everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas - the volume button fell off after 4 months . Have I any rights?
customer_reviews.author: helenaf4

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone
customer_reviews.text: My trusted Samsung S4 mini died on me after four years of good use. I wanted to spend about £110 - £120 on a replacement. After extensive research and the strength of the positive reviews on Amazon I settled for the Moto G7 Play. I certainly made the correct choice. It is a fantastic phone , very fast response times and does everything I want. Excellent camera too. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery
customer_reviews.text: Very good phone for my needs, battery life is amazing ( the main reason for purchase) almost 3 days before a re charge. Everything else about the phone is what you would expect from a Motorola phone
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Great phone with NCF
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the phone assuming it will have NCF, however after reading the reviews I expected no NCF. There is absolutely no details in description, downloaded user guide - again no mentioning NCF, called support - guy didn't know. My phone arrived and YES it has NCF. I am over the moon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value Phone
customer_reviews.text: New phone for the Mrs, wish I hadn't brought it as she is never off it. She really likes it the only gripe is the fingerprint recognition which is carried out at the rear of the phone so if you have a phone case on its not much good. Excellent value and features otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Baggie01black

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Even though it is not the most expensive g7, it doesn't seem slow or hindered in any way. The size is comfortable too. Held up in the correct light, the phone is a nice deep metallic blue, but in normal light, it looks black, so isn't gaudy
customer_reviews.author: balfus

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is the best smartphone I've had for battery power by a fair margin and there are no bugs or niggling irritations. Everything just works and that's what you want.
customer_reviews.author: MoonWeb

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this value for money smartphone. It has alot of features packed in with a brilliant screen size. Fingerprint, face recognition, slow motion camera and more. I love the turbo charging tech that charges it up very quickly. Its way better and advanced than any previous g series made.
customer_reviews.author: Anwar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone for a budget price. It appears to do everything that more expensive phones do, and does them well. Its very intuitive so easy to use. Do not use fingerprint reader or Face Recognition so cannot comment on those functions, but everything else is good!
customer_reviews.author: ROBIN Bull

customer_reviews.title: Even an old man can cope with it!
customer_reviews.text: As a user born in thje mid-twentieth century I can testifiy that the Motorola 7g has been easy to to set up and use. I have to confess that some of the clever bits, such as face and fingerprint recognition don't interest me, so I just use a pass code as previously on my i-phone 5. The camera is excelent, and it has been quite easy for an old man to adjust other features to suit me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money and virtually 'bloat free'
customer_reviews.text: All in all a great phone and very good value for money. Only drawback is the lack of image stabilising on the camera. Probably ok if you are young and have steady hands though.
customer_reviews.author: MR BERNARD COOK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his phone now and actually uses it as all things work. Battery life is excellent as well as camera and other functions. Would recommend if on a budget or dont want to pay a fortune on a big brand .
customer_reviews.author: P.C

customer_reviews.title: Good phone met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Fast works fine takes pretty good pictures. Battery life is good but not spectacular. Finger print reader is fantastic. First time I have had that functionality and works well. Would certainly recommend. Got the Amazon exclusive version with 4Gb Ram.
customer_reviews.author: Ed  Wynn

customer_reviews.title: More backlight please.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive performance for the price. Moves quickly through anything. Not perfect in sunlight, a bit more backlight is needed. Dear developers, where is Motorola migrate?
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Average Smart Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is very good as a smart phone for internet usage - it is lightweight and charges quickly. However the speaker for making phone calls is apauling - "i can't here you" is what you will hear a lot - If you want a phone for web usage mostly great - if you make a lot of calls avoid
customer_reviews.author: Ben Newman

customer_reviews.title: G7 great mobile, fast, high spec includes nfc
customer_reviews.text: Love the Amazon exclusive G7 motorola model (XT1962-5) mobile, which does have nfc, along with lots of other features and a long battery life! Read the technical reviews before buying it and am certainly not disappointed! I also decided on this Motorola as l had a very reliable Motorola mobile years ago. I don't change mobiles that often but this phone was calling to me and then Amazon prime made me an offer I couldn't refuse!
customer_reviews.author: ASB

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for Moto G5. Prefer the fingerprint scanner on the rear and it seems really slick. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gad

customer_reviews.title: Ok phone for the price but better but something else.
customer_reviews.text: Ok phone but poor reception even in areas that Samsung j3 had a good reception.
customer_reviews.author: BAJRAM H.

customer_reviews.title: Motorola phone that performs well against more expensive phones
customer_reviews.text: Best budget phone on the market for 2019. Easy to use, long battery life. Good camera. Very impressed, beats my SE 2018 iPhone hands down. Android has improved 1000% since I first bought one back in 2011. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'm a light phone user, but got fed up with charging my old phone every day or 2. As it aged so charging was required more frequently. Had thus phone a couple of months, and have had 5 days from full to 10%. Does what it says on the tin. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Still
